collection:
This Privacy
Policy explains how information is collected, used, and disclosed by Rapid and
applies to information collected when you interact with the Rapid via our
website or use the online services of the Rapid's API Hub or Rapid's API Hub
for Enterprise (together, the “Services”).

We respect the privacy rights of
individuals interacting with us, our user community, and enterprise customers
and ensure that we protect, manage and control the information we collect
about you per the regulatory obligations associated with Personally
Identifiable Information (herein “PII”).

However, in the
use of the Services, PII such as user name and IDs are captured by our
systems.

**Information Collected**

We may collect certain user information (including personal information and/or
sensitive personal information) in the following ways:  
  
**Information you provide to us**

  * We collect the information you provide directly to us including when you visit our website, register, and use the Rapid's API Hub or Rapid's API Hub for Enterprise.

* For example, we collect information when you interact with Rapid, register as a Rapid user, create or modify your profile, interact with your Rapid online account, access and use API Hub, participate in any interactive feature of the Services, participate in a Rapid sponsored event, apply for a role at Rapid, or request customer support or communicate with us via third-party social media sites.

* The type of information we may collect directly from you includes your name, user name, email address, your picture, your address and contact phone number, information about your preferences in configuration, employer name, job title, transactional data relating to your use of API Hub.

**Information we collect in your use of the Services**

When you access Rapid we may automatically collect information as you use the
Services.

The type of information that we capture includes but may not be
limited to the following:

  * Usage information: We monitor user activity connected with the Services and may collect information about the features and functionality used, the APIs uploaded or downloaded.

* Login information: We log information about you when you access and use API Hub including your Internet Protocol (IP) address, access times, browser types and language, Internet Service Provider (ISP)
  * Device Information: We collect information about the device that you log into the Services from, including the hardware model, operating system and version, and the unique device identifiers
  * Information collected by cookies and other tracking technologies: We use various technologies to collect information, which may include saving cookies to your computer.
* Local Shared Objects “LSO” (Flash Cookies): Rapid uses LSO’s to collect and store information in order to provide certain features on our website.

**Information we collect from other sources**

Rapid may also obtain information from third parties and combine that with
information that we collect via the Services.

**Use of Information**

Rapid may use information collected for the limited purpose of providing the
Services and relating functionality and services, as described in this Privacy
Policy and permitted by applicable laws.

Cookies may contain information that can
identify a user or device whenever you return to the Services.

Rapid leverages
cookies to keep track of services used, records user preferences, keeps track
of browser sessions, delivers relevant advertising, and tracks pages you visit
in order to improve the user experience.

**Third-party Cookies**

Third-party cookies may be placed on your device when you visit the Services.

These cookies allow third parties to gather and track certain information
about user activity or experience.

These cookies can help us analyze how you
use the platform and help us detect or prevent security risks.

**Analytics Cookies**

Analytics cookies monitor how users reach and interact with the Services.

These services will authenticate your identity and
provide you the option to share certain personal information with us such as
your name and email address to pre-populate our sign-up form.

These features may collect
your IP address, which page you are visiting on our website, and may set a
cookie to enable the feature to function properly.

You should
be aware that any information you provide in these areas may be read,
collected, and used by others who access them.

We do not
knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 13.
sharing: Third parties that we may partner with may also use LSO’s in order to provide certain features on our website.

These limited purposes include
circumstances where it is necessary to provide or fulfill services requested
by or for you or where you have given us your consent.

**Compliance with Laws**

We may disclose your information to a third party if (a) we believe that
disclosure is reasonably necessary to comply with any applicable law,
regulation, legal process, or governmental request, (b) to enforce our
agreements, policies, and Terms of Service, (c) to protect the security or
integrity of the Services, (d) to protect Rapid, our customers or the public
from harm or illegal activities, (e) to respond to an emergency which we
believe in the good faith requires us to disclose information to assist in
preventing the death or serious bodily injury of any person or (f) to any
other third party with your prior consent.

**Business Transfers**

We may share or transfer your information in connection with, or during
negotiations of, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition
of all or a portion of our business to another company.

**Aggregated or Anonymized Data**

We may also share aggregated or anonymized information with third parties that
does not directly identify you.

These cookies allow third parties to gather and track certain information
about user activity or experience.

For more information on how to control cookies, check your browser or device’s
settings for how you can control or reject cookies, or visit the following
links:  
  
[Apple Safari](https://support.apple.com/guide/safari/manage-cookies-and-
website-data-sfri11471/mac)  
  
[Google
Chrome](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en)  
  
[Mozilla Firefox](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enhanced-tracking-
protection-firefox-desktop?redirectslug=enable-and-disable-cookies-website-
preferences&redirectlocale=en-US)  
  
[Microsoft Edge](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/microsoft-edge-
browsing-data-and-privacy-bb8174ba-9d73-dcf2-9b4a-c582b4e640dd)  
  
[Microsoft Internet Explorer](https://support.microsoft.com/en-
gb/help/17442/windows-internet-explorer-delete-manage-cookies)  
  
**California Residents**

Under California law, California Residents who have an established
relationship with Rapid may choose to opt out of Rapid's disclosure of
personal information about them to third parties for direct marketing
purposes.

Services like
Facebook Connect give you the option to post information about your activities
on this website to your profile page to share with others within your network.

You should
be aware that any information you provide in these areas may be read,
collected, and used by others who access them.

With your consent, we may post your
testimonial along with your name.
